text: Haha! "I feel as if, whenever I play an Irish lord in CK3, I always have to deal with the English and end up being overwhelmed by them. Terrible game!"
That is an excellent name. Your subconscious is serving you well.
Hooray it’s finally public! So happy for you both! ❤️❤️
I'm almost certain it's been too hyped up by this point, and you'll eat one and go "...that's it?" 😅
Yeah! I had the suit fitting. Gotta meet him again next week - I’ll snap a picture then.
It was some kind of saucy pasta, too, and he was chewing it right behind me. I was torn between vomiting and going full rage demon.
Hell hath a special place for people who bring hot, smelly food onto public transit and then eat it there. 🤢

No no, Australia has bacon. Sorta. "Streaky bacon" here comes closest to the kind from back home. I'm specifically talking about the dehydrated little potato topper things (which are soy, mostly, I think).
I've been to the Vic Market, actually. I could go into it at length, but the cheese options just aren't the same as back home. Australia is very fussy about imports.
Yes, I'm aware of the salad toppers. It's not the same thing, though. North American bacon bits aren't, um... real bacon. 😅
You know, I'd be happy if Australia just had, like, decent cheese. Of any variety.
Come now. They ARE still a former British colony. 😉
They do not. It is a savage land.

Now that I'm using my air fryer regularly, that means I sometimes have baked potatoes. Which means I had to get bacon bits shipped in from overseas, because evidently they're not a thing in Australia.

I remain very North American. 🫠
I have a feeling a clear sign of growing older is having to more and more often go to Google and type things like "what does oomf mean?"
You boil sweetened condensed milk to make dulce de leche. Which I guess is the “toffee” in the banoffee.
I finally bought a pot large enough to boil cans in (for 3 hours, ugh), which means my long-promised banoffee pie is now ready for the office!
Yup. Checks out. 😂

Last night, my brain decided I needed to relive the day I put Ajax to sleep. Only, in my dream, it wasn't Ajax and it wasn't me and it wasn't my home... yet it was, but somehow it was all worse.

So I woke up at 4am, devastated, and couldn't get back to sleep. Please send cute cat pics. I miss them.

Normally I wake up around 8 or 9am every day, with or without the alarm, no matter what time I went to bed (which is occasionally annoying). I didn't set my alarm last night and today I woke up at... noon.

I don't know what to do. It feels like my entire day has slipped away already. 😭
They haven't really promoted the show much since the first season, though. It really deserves more notice.
Really bizarre how Apple+ has done so little to promote For All Mankind. It’s fantastic. It should be winning awards, for the actors especially. But I never hear anything about it.
Think of it like maintenance, but for your muscles. Yes, your masseuse is touching you… but like a mechanic touches a car. It’s not intimacy, it’s therapy.

I went for a long massage today, with a masseuse who had deceptively tremendous strength. Somehow, she realigned my jaw without ever touching it. I'm in so much pain right now, but it feels SO GOOD. 🤗
TFW you're waiting for one specific machine at the gym, and the guy currently on it apparently needs to take 5-10 minutes between each of his many sets to scroll on his phone. 😡
Why, yes, I did just sing Raphael's Final Act at our Christmas Party karaoke. And it was great. 🥳

Air fryer update: still using it! Found a couple of easy meals I like. Order in maybe half as much now? And there are usually green things on my plate! Crazy. It is amazing just how easy it is to cook a nice, juicy chicken breast with this thing.
I worship at the altar of the em-dash.

I was driving behind a car with a license plate that read 1SO 6AY and I thought "that HAS to be a vanity plate".

Five minutes later another had 1AD 5EX and I thought "good on ya, mate".
Well, sure. Let's just toss that on the pile of things to be concerned about, I guess. It was a spectacle, nevertheless, for someone who's clearly trying to maintain a facade of nonchalance.

I watched that interview Mu*k gave and... holy crap. I'm not actually concerned about the guy, because whatever his problems are they're of his own doing, but he legit gives off the air of a man crumbling under the weight of his brain worms.
I still reflexively spit whenever Thatcher's name is mentioned.

I have finished all my Christmas shopping and sent all the parcels away. Granted, I had little choice since I'm not going home this year, but THIS is unprecedented. I have always been a Christmas procrastinator.
Normally I'm all "they're dead, let it go" but there is a short list of people where I'm "yes, let's celebrate the passing of that motherfucker" instead. Kissinger is on it, right next to Thatcher.

Been watching a Korean show on Disney+ called "Moving", and... it's so strange. Started off being about a kid who can barely control his secret power to fly and, halfway through the season, turns into a completely different show about adult super-spies? I'm intrigued but also confused.
I used the word “chockers” today to refer to my current schedule, and I’ve never been more pleased with myself.
It has now officially been two years since I moved to Melbourne. I’m… not entirely sure where the time went. It still feels like I just got here. 😟
It’s where I started! I was so low-key annoyed, and then a minute later I was like “wait wait, what… is happening here?”
I really want to punch up their dialogue, but it's great. They're chatting about why she's eating crisps on the train... but the subtext is heavy. Very charged. 9/10, no notes.

So I'm on the train, with the dude talking loudly on the phone beside me and the lady across from me eating a bag of crisps. And suddenly, still on the phone, he apologises to her and asks if he can have one... and she lets him!

And now they're flirting. 🥴
Is it, though? If I don't give in to Christian baby's demands, the worst it gets for ME is that I feel bad. Supposedly.

In the category of "I'm thinking about this too much", I really have to question the notion that I'm expected to care about this supposedly innocent parachuting baby who can both speak as well as emotionally blackmail me at the expense of their own safety.
Every now and again I turn around and realize they've made yet another Tropico. 🤔

Decided to start off simple with the air fryer: frozen chicken breasts rubbed with paprika and garlic and baked potatoes. Both turned out perfectly! Juiciest chicken I've had in quite some time, even! 🤗
Which is totally fair. 😅
Wait wait wait... is this someone else's cat? Or do you now have a cat?
So our little game kinda just got  nominated for a Grammy 😱
I recall originally thinking either Telegu or Gujarati, but considering her first name it’s very possible!
I don’t know where this Blue Eye Samurai came from, but it’s amazing. I’m sold after just one episode.
I have ordered an air fryer. Half expect this is going to end up in a cupboard, but everyone I know speaks so highly of them I just have to give it a shot.
I've long had the feeling that execs trying to prove that "something is being done" to shareholders who neither know nor care about anything but their bottom line is the source of most ills.
Whoa whoa whoa you're talking about the livelihood of real people, with lives! You want to impact their bonuses based on, what? "Accountability"??
Decided to take my birthday - and the next couple of weeks - off with a bit of staycation. Started with a massage. Moisturized, unbothered, flourishing, in my lane, etc. etc. 🫠
I finally did my Australian taxes today - exciting, right? I know! Since Messina was a block away, I decided the occasion called for some gelato. So all has balanced out. 🤗
Aw, no. I watched that show, and I can just imagine! Hugs from afar. 🫂💕
It doesn't feel real once it's out, tbh.
Yeah, I read the books and loved them a lot! Probably why I didn't care for the sequel, tbh.
Watching Silence of the Lambs again, on a lark. Damn, I love this movie.
I’m sorry, but I don’t remember the origin any longer.

I just can't even read the news this morning. The Australian referendum, the NZ election, everything coming out of Palestine and Israel... the historian in me wants to say "it's been this bad before", and I'm sure that's true, but it's still a struggle. Time to hole up under a rock. 😔
I want to take time off of work, but the thought of needing to go on vacation and actually *do* something with my time off makes me want to weep. That's how tired I am.
I'm still on Twitter quite a bit and it's simply not a way to stay informed now. So you're better off here, tbh.

I hadn't realized how much I relied on Twitter for keeping me abreast of current events until the events in Ukraine and Israel/Palestine... where it's completely incoherent and impossible to follow. And here I sit not yet having internalized an alternative so I just keep up to date on... nothing. 😔

Wow. Imagine being such a fan of the Wheel of Time novels you get angry that the Amazon adaptation improved so much over the first season but still refused to religiously adhere to every single thing in the books - which were, in my memory, pretty mid and self-indulgent. Fans are so weird. 🤔

I am through being all emotional and teary eyed this week, about my game and my wonderful team. I can feel my Teutonic ancestors glaring down at me in disapproval. It is time to be cold and stoic instead.
Okay, this one felt good. ☺️

NEW EPISODE -> bit.ly/David-Gaider Veteran narrative designer @@775 joins me this week to share his experiences writing video games - and creating Stray Gods! 

#NarrativeDesigner #VideoGameWriting #DavidGaider #TheCornerOfStoryAndGame #Podcast #SummerfallStudios #WritingAdvice
Be that as it may, I don’t care enough to wade past it.
Exactly. I'm not telling them they HAVE to feel bad about it, but come on. You're not stealing bread to feed your starving family. Stop pretending this isn't theft.

I swear to god, the whole "piracy is not theft" discourse is the one thing guaranteed to make me foam at the mouth. It absolutely IS theft. It's just theft you're okay with, and now trying to justify.

The reaction some people have to unions is so odd. I mean, sure. Unions can be corrupt, annoying, etc. They are far from perfect, I agree. But *waves hands* we SEE what happens when corporations have a free hand with employees. This feels like a "but Biden isn't great either!" kind of discussion.
Yeah, that's nice for them. I break out in hives.
I liked the first season of Heartstopper, but I bounced off the second season. The twee was just too strong. 😅
Finished watching the final season of Sex Education. A nice send-off for the characters, I think, though I still hate Otis. He remains unredeemed. Cried more often than I care to admit.
Most of this week is me getting up at 3am for meetings, and I'm already destroyed. I'm currently at that level of exhaustion where I feel drunk. 🤪
I'm well-versed in False Spring - Edmonton experiences several every year. We're back in El Nino, though, so my hope is that this one takes. 😅
The party pope awaits!

The chilly, drizzly Melbourne winter finally broke yesterday as it got up to 25C. The air is warm, you can smell the flowers already, and I swear I had a literal Hills Are Alive with the Sound of Music twirling moment as I was walking to the tram. 😁
Me: (ending a phone call with someone I'm unlikely to ever speak with again) "Talk to you later!" 😭
I would never in a million years have predicted that Richard, who I loathed every time he was on screen, would end up being the arc I liked the most.
I originally abandoned the show after episode 2 in season 1, because it was so stressful to watch. I'm glad I went back and tried again, because it's so great.
Aww, thank you! ❤️

Yeah, most will never understand what it's like to be on the receiving end. You could respond to each and every post, and every time Someone Out There sees any reference it's like it just happened and it starts all over again. Nobody looks deeper than that first post, after all, but you get it all.

Really enjoying the Stray Gods fans being totally normal about Freddie and Persephone. My first time writing lesbian romances, and it seems I did OK? I'll admit to being pretty nervous about it... there are certain parties out there who were/are pretty certain I couldn't do it. 😅
"Your order's here early!" Yes, Uber Eats, thank you. You kept upping the arrival time, the later he became, so of course he arrived before it. Easy to score if you keep moving the goalpost. 😠
Stray Gods has been nominated for 5 AGDA’s, and I am at once both elated as well as horrified because I’m in 5am VO sessions the day before and after the ceremonies. 😳

Reading the comments on Volition's shuttering, heartlessly and gleefully snickering because Volition didn't give them the Saints Row reboot they apparently wanted, has to be the most depressing thing I can imagine. 😔
This is so much the most you I've ever heard distilled into one statement, I can't quite describe it.

People always seem to think they need to learn some complicated tool. And it's like "no, I just need you to show me you can let the reader feel like they're in charge but still get them where they need to be." That's it. I don't care how they do it, so long as I can read it.
Thanks, Brianne! Please extend a big hug from me to everyone in the writers pit. ❤️
For how long, Elizabeth? FOR HOW LONG

I mean, I suppose I should be grateful. Anything that helps my little indie game gets noticed is, right? It just gives me pause every time I'm about to post. Like "this is going to be an article tomorrow." 😐

I've been tweeting a bit more lately (I still want to call it that!) mainly because my following on X is bigger and our game just came out, so I'm told I have to keep my profile up... but lately my every other tweet has been turned into a gaming news article and it is SO UNNERVING. I want to hide. 😭

Finished BG3, finally. Had some issues with the ending, well - with a bunch of things, really - but wow. What an achievement. The stars that must have all aligned at once to make this come to be, so incredible. All the good, nerdy neurons firing all at once, all the time. 🙌
I can't quite describe the feeling in BG3 of encountering and fighting one of the first characters I ever wrote, and then having to decide whether you kill her. 😳
Angry, mostly, but only on behalf of those affected. I got out. And if I never hear the word "agile" again, it will be too soon.
Brutal
Right there with you. Fuming.
And Mary was the master of making that one dry takedown of your plot in a writer review which annoyed you because she was RIGHT. Consistently.
Yeah. Heck, Luke trained ME. I still remember starting on BG2 in 1999, and Luke was already the tired, grizzled veteran who wrote characters I could never imitate. He *created* the BioWare Style.
I'm so angry and simultaneously feeling so helpless today that @@169003 has offered to bring me gelato to cool my heels in and I'm not gonna turn THAT down.
I can't quite wrap my head around the attitude where someone who contributed so much to the company's success could be looked on simply as "too expensive".

I can't really say, considering I'm not privy to the inner workings, but I imagine this is part of EA overall cost-cutting strategy. I wouldn't be surprised to hear of more EA studios doing the same thing in the days to come.

I remember when BioWare removed our free two weeks off at Christmas benefit, which we'd had since Bio began, with a cheery email about how great it was that we were "more closely aligning with EA policy". Almost more galling than the thing itself.

Some news just shouldn't be sugar-coated, man.

You know, if they want to make an entire toy-related multiverse full of movies as subversive as Barbie, then cool. I suspect, however, that's not the takeaway the Mattel execs will have. There'll just be way more eyes on these projects, and they'll all be expected to hit $1 billion+ ...somehow.

I suspect the actual use of EA players as QA is pretty limited. Bad QA is almost singularly useless. In terms of providing the studio with needed development funds, however, it's probably quite important.
I know there are reasons this is done but, every single time a game hypes their release date only for me to then discover it's "releasing" in Early Access, I feel a tiny bit betrayed.
I somehow made it to launch day! Making an attempt to not read and dwell upon every review as they come out. A valiant one. It'll work out well for me, I'm certain.
I'm great. I've slept wonderfully. No anxiety, haven't thrown up at all. How are you?
It seems like even the Australians who HAVE experienced snow see it as this fun, novel playground they get to dance around in and then leave.
Another answer would be "The idea that my emotional manipulation might make you sad makes me also sad. And also your favourite follower."

My friend Stevie asked permission to read one of my novels on TikTok to document his transition (as is the millennial way) as he begins T. He didn't need my permission, ofc, but I readily gave it and I think this is fantastic. I'm so thrilled for him!
I told Jess that her character was giving me big Maya Hawke vibes and I stand by it. She's amazing. The character, yes, but also Maya.

Funny that we got to the end of the session and there'd been so much dice-rolling and intense problem solving it almost FELT like there had been combat... but nope. Just skill checks. I've never tried that before, as a DM, and it went so well I'll now have to add it into my DM toolbox.

The one that worked best, however, was a section of the maze where the party needed to use stealth and perception checks to sneak past a powerful monster. I set up waypoints and used cumulative successes/failures to determine the result... and it was SO intense and rewarding for everyone.

Probably my favourite was when the party encountered a floor puzzle/trap... and they instantly noped out of it. They used teleport spells to rig up ropes that allowed everyone else to simply climb OVER the floor and never touch it, not even attempting to solve the puzzle. I was highly amused.

D&D this weekend went really well. The party made their way through a maze intended to test them in several ways with different skill checks... and somehow it all worked. I let them come up with out-of-the-box solutions for each situation and it all ended up being incredibly fun!

Just saw a post with some examples of AI-generated videos and I'm not sure whether to laugh at how utterly garbage and devoid of all emotion or coherence they all were or to cry over how many responded with ooohs and aaahs and seemed actually taken with their utter amazingness and "potential".

Dayla wanted me to know that, if I were so inclined, she was available to share in my dinner.

Immediately after this photo, she farted so loudly she startled herself. We'll, both of us, really.
That's quite the precedent, if so. Just clone and BOOM. Infinity Stone power! 🤘

I mean, they fell for the Metaverse once, right? They'll fall for it again. These tech companies can bleed cash like a flood and yet be kept afloat for years based only on sultry promises whispered into the ears of investors.

Maybe the whole Twitter name change is just about drumming up investment. I can picture Elon pitching a "revamp" of Twitter to tech bros more clueless than him. "It'll do everything! It's the Metaverse without the sucky graphics! And lookit that sexy X!" And the tech bros begin drooling.
Okay, so just how is copying Captain Marvel's or Wanda's DNA supposed to replicate the power of an Infinity Stone?! Comic geek me is gnashing my teeth in annoyance right now. 😠

They took a decent event storyline from the comics and turned it into a dull, pointless, too-short series with an incredibly anticlimactic (and poorly conceived) ending. So... yeah, it's really that bad imo.
I blame the movie for dropping the ball on Scarlet Witch, but the ball's been dropped either way, yeah. 😞
It's a very low bar.
Hmm. Daredevil I'd need to separate by season, but the 1st and 3rd season are at the top. Jessica Jones in the middle, Luke Cage near the bottom, Iron Fist just above Secret Invasion.

Updated personal rankings of Marvel shows:

1) WandaVision
2) Hawkeye
3) Loki
4) She-Hulk
   (big jump)
5) Moon Knight
6) What If...?
   (bigger jump)
7) Ms. Marvel
8) Falcon & the Winter Soldier
9) Secret Invasion

Ms. Marvel is probably better than I ranked it... it just wasn't for me.

I'll never be able to look at any movie which depicts a coherent societal response to pandemics or UFO's the same ever again. "The government released information and everyone just... believes it? Come ON."
Yeah, I guess there's kind of been a determined effort since DS9 to make Starfleet (and humanity) more realistically flawed... so this is a return to optimism in many ways, you're right.
I'm unsure what part of that told you I immediately wanted to know, but... thanks, I guess.
Do I want to know? I probably do not. 😔

Right? He was kind of low-key universally acknowledged as this generation's genius wunderkind. And then, in quick succession:

Oops, not a genius.
Oops, not that good at business.
Oops, not even that smart, really.
Oops, a complete and utter moron.
I might do that, thanks! It's one of the Infocom classics that gets mentioned in the same breath as A Mind Forever Voyaging, and I always regretted not trying harder to get back to it.
If there's anything the past year has done, it's dispelled the notion that becoming a billionaire requires actual business acumen, maturity, or even intelligence really. It's rather sobering.
Wait, does this mean you read Cerebus? I loved it, once upon a time, but it never gets mentioned in the public sphere ever... to the point where I've begun to wonder if I imagined the entire thing.
Voyage Home is great! It's the Ragnarok to The Final Frontier's Love & Thunder.

I'm trying to pin down what makes Strange New Worlds so damn good (and better than Discovery, much as I also like it). Aside from the focus on character over plot, I think it might just be that it's remembered that Star Trek is fun. It has a real sense of joy which, I think, has maybe been missing.

I remember trying to play that, but it was back in the era where, if you couldn't figure a puzzle out, you were simply stuck... and I got stuck very early (I think it's one of their higher difficulty titles) and thus had to simply stop playing.
You know, I may not be part of the Barbie audience and that's OK... but I kinda wish I was. I could use some unadulterated joy right about now. Even the very pink sort. 😔
Oh, good. I thought it was just me. Started watching it and I was like "what the teenage fuck?"
I have no Barbie nostalgia and zero interest in the movie. Less than zero, if I'm honest. Never have I felt so simultaneously out of touch with the zeitgeist as well as Not Gay Enough.
I think self-awareness is key. You have it, so you don't need to worry. I think. Or maybe I should worry? Goddammit.

Finished playing Jagged Alliance 3 last night. It's pretty faithful to the style of JA2... perhaps TOO faithful, considering JA2 is from a different era. Still enjoyed it relentlessly. Something about turn-based combat mechanics does it for me every single time, I dunno.
I see the Discourse has made its way to Bluesky. Not that I'm surprised, really, but in the list of things that make me feel very, very tired that ranks... up there.
“Skeets”, apparently. 🤷‍♂️

One of my laments in making Stray Gods was discovering my skills didn’t transfer to writing lyrics. It’s a whole thing of it’s own, apparently. Who knew? 😅

Well, I finally wrote a song and Austin said he liked it. I’ve hit base competency at lyric writing and I’m sooo happy. I’m not even joking. 🎉
That’s one of the things I miss. Thunderstorms are so rare here in Melbourne. Even when they occur, they’re never house-shakers.
Today I met a doggie who was SO excited to see me. He wanted to jump up on me so badly. His owner wouldn't let him, but he oh so wanted to! And now I remember why people have pets.
Considering just how much they’ve obfuscated the option to delete, I’m more inclined to believe it’s simply them trying to make it as difficult as possible… but you’re probably right.

Why the heck does it take a MONTH to delete my Instagram account? "Your account has been scheduled for deletion." Or you could do it RIGHT NOW, goddammit!

I won't even tell you about the journey I had to go on just to find the OPTION to delete it.

Today's crazy-talker sermon on the Melbourne tram: the nature of infinity, and also how negativity has impacted the timeline (which incidentally also wiped his mind - several times!)... so, if we don't stay positive for the rest of the day, he's going to kill us.

Nuance really is dead. At the end of the day, though, I usually end up thinking to myself: "is the opinion of yet one more white dude really even needed here, anyhow?" And the answer almost always is "nah".

Makes it difficult to talk about those things, too. The "go woke, go broke" crowd latches onto those with such ferocity that ANY criticism you make feels like you'll be lumped in with them. So you end up... not saying anything at all, for the most part.
Man, streaming services that don’t have a way to remove shows from “continue watching” are so aggravating. The category turns into a graveyard full of every show I ever hated and gave up on.
Not yet, no. Lack of invites, I imagine.
The fact I could type it instead of seeing it made it all new again, honestly
lady_spits_out_coffee_laughing.gif

For any game development folks here who don't check Twitter any longer: Jay Watamaniuk is one of those Narrative Designers who quietly worked behind the scenes to make BioWare what it is. If you know of a position requiring lots of experience, I suggest reaching out. You won't find anyone finer.
Hmm. I didn't think Marvel could make something that bored me more than Falcon & the Winter Soldier, yet Secret Invasion was released and here we are. 😴

They've got the user base, though. Or it seems like they do. If they reach enough critical mass, people may feel compelled to go there -- whether to be part of the zeitgeist, for marketing, or whatever -- despite all its other awfulness.

This makes me sad, because I want Sandman S2 to be as amazing as the first, but it also makes me very happy because I want the writers behind it (and every other show I enjoy) to reap the benefits they deserve for creating something I love. Here's to hoping the studios see sense.

Maybe that's all social media, as far as they're concerned. A delivery mechanism. The whole "but for a while it was great at social change!" I've heard lately is such nonsense. Yet I honestly don't know if there's a way to escape it, in the long run, other than becoming a tech hermit.

Threads -- and Twitter, more and more -- is built on the idea of "You're not here to curate your experience. This is not FOR you. You will be forced to engage with power users and brands, based on the algorithm, because you are both captive audience and product. Enjoyment is tertiary."

I've seen so many posts like "they had ONE job - make it like old Twitter!" and I'm sitting here just "oh, you think THAT'S the takeaway tech bros have about old Twitter?" If they look on it as anything other than a cautionary tale, I'd be surprised.

I'll fully admit that I may have to succumb and go onto Threads if it succeeds in generating enough critical mass, but man... every new piece of info I see about it just makes it seem like the absolute worst of all worlds. Facebook as Twitter, but with even less control and even more invasiveness.
I'll admit, I threw up in my mouth a little while writing it.
Gamers are your customers. All gamers. Treat any gamers that grace you with feedback as if you were waiting on their table at a restaurant. And remember: service with a smile!

10 games to get to know me:

Crusader Kings II
X-COM: Apocalypse
Fallout 2
Sega Genesis Shadowrun
Sim City 2000
Uncharted: The Lost Legacy
Jagged Alliance 2
Darklands
Civilization II
A Mind Forever Voyaging

Of course, what debate means to those whose entire identity revolves around "owning libs" is mostly "can I frustrate someone who objectively knows more than I do about this topic by questioning the very basis of information and reality until they feel gaslighted?". Less of that, almost certainly.
I, for one, am relieved. 🥳

Apparently some folks were unpleasantly startled that Jaskier was revealed to be bisexual in Witcher season 3, and honestly I'm just... that is the *least* surprising revelation one could possibly make about the party bard who's also known as "Dandelion".
@@774 They put it out just for you. If only it was pork.
I honestly wasn't prepared for just how much of Melbourne's cuisine would revolve around savoury pies and dumplings. We have both of these back in Canada... I think? But this is on another level.
I mean, there's a RUMOUR

I mean, I know they probably have to pump those out in record time, but it'd be nice if at least one of them ever reached out for comment. "Yeah, my comment is there's another Lead Writer on Dragon Age now, I haven't worked at BioWare in forever, and I have no idea what goes on there these days."

One thing I'm glad to get a reprieve from here (for now) is that thing where some journos mine my tweets to write snappy articles like BioWare made some press release about Starfield instead of "Guy Who Hasn't Worked at BioWare in Six Years Makes Mostly-Uninformed Tweet About Starfield Romances".
If you're games industry and following some folks already, reply with who you are and what you do, and then re-post this or whatever it's called. Let's try and find each other on this new place

An intro! I'm Dave, Creative Director at Summerfall Studios in Melbourne (Our first indie title, Stray Gods, comes out in August!). Most folks probably know me better from my stint as Lead Narrative Designer for the Dragon Age series at BioWare, where I worked for 17 years.
The pain caused by the lack of emojis when posting here from my desktop makes Early Aughts Dave, who scoffed at the use of emojis, laugh and laugh and laugh.
Yeah, I'd already moved onto "guess we're cutting this and how will I work around that being gone" and now it just... works. So both the original effort AND the time I spent moving on are a waste.

The worst part is that the answer was right in front of me, and I have no idea why I didn't see it. When I had the idea, I thought "No... it can't be THAT simple, can it?" I can't even brag about the effort it took, because any scripter I tell would probably go "well, yeah, duh".

Banged my head against a scripting issue for an entire day, then finally gave up and decided it just wasn't possible to do. Went to bed, woke up this morning with a "what if I did...?" idea and 10 minutes later it worked perfectly.

I don't know whether to be grateful or cry.
It's at once both pretty important but also recognizably complicated, so naturally the end result is we've put off making a final decision until more fires go out. ;)
Considering the price of a movie is so high, I've found I generally only go when it's a movie I REALLY want to see. So I've become much more picky than back in ye olde dayes (aka pre-covid era).
I made it! Slid under the door just as it was rising. Now all I need to do is find my fellow refugees so my timeline isn’t so barren. 😅
